messages.content: I think for flexgrid and fixed grid, you should be able to add a model to capture this mode as a type similar to the Devicetype and Moduletype
One other thing to consider is the newer DWDM system uses a flexgrid rather than a fixed grid. What that means is the DWDM channel numbers are not set and the widths are variable.
Adva is close to that yes. They have a managment module for each shelf and a node management module. So for most deployments the first shelf has both management cards in it.

Would you consider your "DWDM system" as a Device or as a "cluster / virtual chassis" and the Device would be Shelves ?

Each node is a single device and not a cluster or virtual chassis, but each node can have multiple shelves. Our DWDM system is Adva Optical which was recently purchased by Adtran. In their design the shelf is basically only there to provide power and centralized inventory. All functions are handled by a module/linecard and each module/linecard is wired individually to the appropriate modules/linecards.

One thing I know we have with our DWDM system is it can have multiple shelves, each shelf can have multiple modules, line cards, and ports, each module can have multiple line cards and ports, and finally each line card can have multiple ports. Some of these ports are even simplex meaning one way. (Tx and Rx have different paths through a node) I think your example is a good start, it gives us a starting point and helps us better understand how we might build out our schema. What would be the best way to model a simplex or one-way connection? Also with our DWDM vendor many of the ports on a node are connected to other ports on the same node. (might be a different shelf, module, linecard, etc) Is there any special concerns we might have modeling that?
It looks like a good start. Helps me better understand how this could work for us.
